title: Installation
description: Learn how to install FlexiUI in your project.

body.raw:
# Installation Get started with FlexiUI by installing it in your React project. ## Prerequisites Before you begin, make sure you have the following installed: - Node.js 18.x or higher - React 18 or React 19 - Tailwind CSS 4.x ## Install FlexiUI Install FlexiUI and its dependencies using your preferred package manager: ### npm ```bash npm install @flexi-ui/react @flexi-ui/theme ``` ### pnpm ```bash pnpm add @flexi-ui/react @flexi-ui/theme ``` ### yarn ```bash yarn add @flexi-ui/react @flexi-ui/theme ``` ## Tailwind CSS Setup FlexiUI is built on top of Tailwind CSS. Add the FlexiUI plugin to your Tailwind configuration: ### tailwind.config.js ```javascript import { flexiui } from '@flexi-ui/theme' /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ export default { content: [ './app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}', './components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}', './node_modules/@flexi-ui/theme/dist/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}', ], theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [flexiui()], } ``` ## Provider Setup Wrap your application with the FlexiUIProvider: ```tsx import { FlexiUIProvider } from '@flexi-ui/system' export default function App({ Component, pageProps }) { return ( ) } ``` ## Using Components Now you can import and use FlexiUI components in your application: ```tsx import { Button } from '@flexi-ui/button' export default function Home() { return (
) } ``` ## Next Steps - [Learn about routing integration](/docs/guide/routing) - [Customize your theme](/docs/customization/theme) - [Explore components](/docs/components/button)
